description:
Job Description:
The position includes implementation and development in SSJS, AMPscript and integration as part of the marketing automation team
Qualifications:
– Bachelor’s degree graduate and / or graduate of a full-stack or equivalent course

– At least six months’ practical experience in CSS \ HTML \ JavaScript

– High ability of self-learning and entry into new tools.

– A desire to study Salesforce technologies and other integration technologies and develop in the field.

– Diligence, striving for a goal, ability to promote several topics simultaneously.

– Experience in writing SQL – an advantage

– Experience with automatic tools (testing / sending emails) – an advantage

– Knowledge in marketing cloud – an advantage
תיאור תפקיד:
התפקיד כולל יישום ופיתוח בשפות SSJS , AMPscript והשתלבות כחלק מצוות ה-marketing automation
דרישות תפקיד:
בוגר תואר ראשון ו\או בוגר קורס fullstack או מקביל
ניסיון מעשי של חצי שנה לפחות ב- CSS\HTML\JavaScript
יכולת גבוהה של למידה עצמית וכניסה לכלים חדשים.
רצון ללמוד טכנולוגיות Salesforce וטכנולוגיות אינטגרציה נוספות ולהתפתח בתחום.
חריצות, חתירה למטרה, יכולת לקדם מספר נושאים במקביל.
ניסיון בכתיבת SQL– יתרון
ניסיון בכלים אוטומטיים (בדיקות \ שליחת מיילים) – יתרון
יתרון בmarketing cloud
Location:
Ramat Hachayal
Position:
Full Time
Suitable:
Inexperienced AcademicsShow more Report

A company that is building the future of audio advertising is looking for a Customer Success Manager. It's a startup focused on creating solutions for publishers to unlock the fastest-growing segment of marketing spend, and empowering advertisers to reach mobile audiences at scale.
As a Customer Success Manager, you’ll oversee existing publisher accounts. Through day-to-day communication, you’ll build strong relationships and establish growth and up-sell strategies tailored to your book of business. Additionally, you’ll be responsible for onboarding new publishers, while working with counterparts internally and externally to ensure that all technical and performance issues are resolved quickly and appropriately.
Success in this role is achieved through building strong relationships, up-selling, performance analysis, technical support, and optimization. The strategic partnership manager is expected to actively contribute to the ongoing success of the business while working in close partnership with the sales, product, and R&D.
Job Description:
Communicate and work closely with Advertisers and Publishers worldwide to manage relationships.
Growing revenue from existing accounts and clients.
Performance and technical focal point for product integration, best practices, and overall account operations.
Manage and optimize campaigns; analyze performance and recommend/implement improvements to meet customers’ monetization objectives.
Supporting the sales team in pre and post-sale stages.
Requirements :
Minimum 1-year experience within a global advertising or gaming company.
2 years experience in client management from global operating companies.
English at a native level.
Sales-oriented, strong ability to negotiate.
Strong interpersonal skills to interact with clients, management, and peers.
Ability to multitask and handle various priorities.
Details-oriented with an ability to see the bigger picture.
Passionate for games and knowledge of the gaming industry.
Bachelor degree.Show more Report

Marketing & congresses Coordinator
JOB DESCRIPTION:
MAIN PURPOSE
Responsible for logistical and all administrative related tasks for PN & MN marketing teams including support, collaboration, and full assistance to meet the work plan.
CORE JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Responsible for logistical and all administrative related tasks for PN & MN marketing and sales teams including the production of promotional materials, engage with suppliers, coordinate meetings, manage PO’s, full support with conferences administration etc.
Coordinate the execution and produce promotional materials – bid offer from suppliers, working with graphic needs and manage the budget.
Follow-up promotional materials stock and actively update product managers accordingly.
Logistic coordination of conferences as per project managers’ needs.
Budget administrative management (Full cycle – from PO to payment). Including Sap
Support and coordinate “cross department / division” projects.
Coordinate meetings upon request.
Provide full support to PN&MN sales force in terms of promotional materials, products samples, information on conferences / events, support with price offers, etc.
Back-Up to the front desk upon need.
Upload Veeva materials for PN
Support PN social activities
Support Congresses and lectures – PSA, Sponsorships
Donation processes
GENERAL RESPONSIBILITY
Responsible for logistical and all administrative related tasks for PN & MN marketing teams.
ACCOUNTABILITY
Ensure delivery of tasks on time in full.
Understand and adhere to Abbott policies.
Adequate and accurate reporting and administration.
Achieving deadlines.
QUALIFICATIONS
Service and results oriented.
Proactive and positive approach.
Responsible.
Well organized.
Good listening and communication abilities.
Confidential and trustworthy.
EXPERIENCE
B.A degree (preferably economics, marketing or business).
Great computer skills.
Ability to communicate in English.
Previous administrative experience / Previous marketing experience / Previous customer support experience.Show more Report

Seperia builds and operates global fintech review sites. From 2003, we have been driving millions of sales to our partners (advertisers). We do it by focusing on value added content, wrapped within an engaging web product and matched with high intent traffic.

We’re looking for our next Junior PPC Campaign Manager.

What You Will Do:
Analysis and optimization of paid search accounts in Google Ads, Yahoo and Bing
Work to meet numerical CPA and acquisition volume targets
Keyword discovery and taxonomy – Create comprehensive keyword lists and assign them into classes and categories for implementation in the ad systems
Write ad creatives for different channels and groups
Reporting
What You Need:
Up to 1-year of hands-on experience with Google Ads
Strong analytical skills
Must be highly organized and sharp individual
High work ethics and focus on measurable results
Self-starter with excellent communication & collaboration skills
High level of English
What We Offer:
GROWTH – we believe in growing our own talent, through learning workshops, professional sessions, team meetings, and work experience. Our company culture celebrates employee growth and development.
FREEDOM- we care less about formalities, and more about results. With a dynamic, informal environment, we keep excellence, innovation, and results at the forefront.
UPSIDE – as a performance marketing company, we develop global-level, scalable marketing assets with no glass ceiling. You can enjoy a growing upside.This position offers a highly unique work environment and excellent career prospects.Show more Report

About Us
With over 30 Million users on our platform, we’re here to change the future of business. Our all-in-one platform makes starting a business affordable and accessible to everyone – we welcome more than 800k new business owners every month. From our products to our careers, there are endless opportunities for growth.
Our team | Our core | Our dream fulfillers
When we started Tailor Brands, we wanted to help people to accelerate their growth and fulfill their dreams. This also defines us internally; we put our focus on maximizing individual impact and creating an environment of absolute transparency.
About the role
As a Junior Product Marketing Manager, you’ll be managing Tailor Brand’s email funnels, automation, pop-ups, and user journeys: from ideation, through configuration to analysis & optimization.
You’ll be Tailor Brand’s go-to person with everything related to email automation - collaborating with content, paid acquisition and product, orchestrating Tailor Brands’s automated communications aligned with business and brand goals.
We’re looking for an individual who’s a self-starter — someone who knows how to get things done but always seeks ways to innovate and test new ideas.
Manage email automation and email funnels, including content messaging strategy
Monitor email performance, deliverability, analyze results, and enhance campaigns accordingly. Refine email marketing strategy to increase engagement, retention, and conversions
Management of triggered email campaigns throughout the customer lifecycle to maximize business KPIs
Initiating, conducting and measuring A/B tests in emails
Prioritize and manage multiple projects at once with exceptional attention to detail
Drive competitive analysis and market research
Provision of creative briefs for content & design teams to create assets for emails
Work closely with Product Managers, Designers, Developers, and CS teams
Requirements:

Passion and knowledge about the Product Marketing field, especially Email Marketing experience, managing large scale global email campaigns
An analytical B.A./B.Sc. from a leading academic institution
Strong analytical and project management skills
Time management and attention to details
Excellent interpersonal, communication and cross-group skills
A passion for innovating and bringing new ideas to the table, and turning your approved ideas into actionable projects while seeing them through from start to finish
Fluency in spoken/written English
Nice-to-haves
Knowledge & experience in HTML & CSS
Proven experience in the SaaS industry
We are located in Tel Aviv but Hybrid mode is on!
Our team is currently working in hybrid mode. Those who prefer to work in our office can do so in a safe environment.Show more Report

We are looking for a data analyst for the Marketing Analytics team of an international game development company founded in 2009, dedicated to creating the best mobile and social experience for hardcore and casual gamers worldwide. With over 250 million registered users, this company is consistently ranked among top game developers.
The company employs more than 1,500 individuals worldwide and is headquartered in Herzliya Israel, with eight offices and development studios across Europe and the United States. The company's games are available on iOS, Android, and all major social networks.
The Business Performance department is in charge of all the analytical aspects of the game operations and strategic planning: From game design to user acquisition, player behavior, live-ops, and game optimization (such as monetization, retention, etc).
The scope of responsibility of this team includes budget optimization for user acquisition for the company's games at the scope of tens of million dollars per game, analysis of game profitability and long term potential, analysis of the players' behavior, player game funnel and reaction to new game features and offers, and many more. The goal is to make sure the company brings the best and most relevant players to its games in the most efficient and effective way.

Responsibilities:
Be an analytical focal point for anything related to UA, New user performance KPIs, monthly budget planning, tests and performance monitoring
Be a focal point for anything related to new players' performance and KPIs across our range of games, strategic planning, user segmentation, tests and growth opportunities identification
Daily support of ongoing analytical needs of the marketing department managers & teams
Establish and monitor success metrics that measure and explain the impact of the marketing activities
Ability to work across multiple data sources in order to research and capture the full activity.
Design and initiate new features and reports to monitor & give insights on the marketing activity, using the marketing in-house BI system (for example, LTV, ROI forecasting, automatic rules)
Collaborate with the game analysis team and the game studios to monitor and optimize the company's players experience, maximizing their retention in the games
Requirements:
At least 2 years of previous experience as a data analyst; additional experience in marketing analytics- A must
Proven experience with measuring online success and identifying optimization opportunities
Excellent understanding of online marketing metrics (user funnel, user acquisition KPI’s)
Experience in researching large amounts of raw data and a technical orientation.
SQL Server and Google big Query experience
High level of proficiency in SQL & Excel (Python - an advantage)
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Qlik Sense
Excellent English communication and presentation skills
Passion for Gaming – an advantage
A/BSc in an analytical field such Statistics, Industrial Engineering or similar from a leading universityShow more Report

About The Position
Jifiti is a cutting-edge fintech company that's driving the technology for leading banks and retailers worldwide. We’re growing quickly following an investment of over $20M by the company that owns IKEA. So we need people like you – smart, energetic, and with a passion for getting great things done for some of the most iconic brands in the world.
We are looking for a talented, experienced Product Marketing Manager to join our Product team. A motivated, innovative, and results-driven storyteller that combines a business perspective with a technical understanding.
This person will be in charge of driving our message across the company and beyond.
Responsibilities
Produce a variety of product content and sales collateral assets, including sales presentations, demos, product brochures, case studies, video content, white papers, webinars, and more.
Develop tools and training to support the sales and marketing teams, as well as materials directly facing our B2B clients - both business clients and developers/technical users.
Build and manage content tools and platforms to make the content easily accessible to its audience.
Work closely with product managers, graphic designers, sales, and other stakeholders to identify needs and sharpen product offering and positioning in the market.
Become a subject matter expert in consumer financing with an in-depth understanding of the market and competition, in-depth knowledge of our products, value proposition, features and use cases.
Requirements
At least 2 years of experience in Product Marketing/Content Writing/Sales Enablement for a B2B SaaS company.
Experience creating materials for developers, and doing technical product marketing
A talented storyteller with technical understanding who can build and deliver compelling company and product presentations.
A good eye for detail, design, and UX.
Strong writing skills with hands-on experience creating high-quality product content.
Mother tongue level English with exemplary communications skills.
Ability to distil complex concepts into clear, concise language and business values.
Experience in payments / Fintech domains and ecosystem - advantage.Show more Report

Browzwear’s mission is to revolutionize the fashion industry with our 3D end-to-end solutions.
We develop innovative, cutting-edge 3D garment simulation technology which enables digital workflow, creative design, faster time to market, less garment waste, and enriches the online shopping experience.
This is your chance to play a leading role at the forefront of the digital revolution in the apparel industry.
We are looking for a director of web products: someone who is a natural leader, manager, and people person, but who also understands the importance of quality in product development. You have the skill set to inspire your colleagues, carefully nurturing their development, while simultaneously ensuring smooth and near flawless product management leading to top quality projects being delivered on time.
Responsibilities
Together with the management team, build the product strategy, communicate it throughout the company, and make sure everyone is aligned with it
Shape and lead the product group (PMs, design, UX, data) to define its structure, culture, and agenda
Hire, lead, and mentor exceptional people in your team so as to help them grow their capabilities
Work closely with the business and marketing teams to develop growth strategies that will make an impact
Implement product methodologies and nurture a product first culture across the company
Build and lead customer-centric processes, making sure that everything we do creates value to our customers and our business
Do hands-on product work as the need arises
Build data-driven methods to increase utilization, drive retention, and trigger expansion
Requirements:

Requirements
Well-rounded product management experience, preferably from several companies and different products
Proven experience in WEB/SAAS product companies
Strong leadership abilities, proven experience in leading multi-disciplined teams (product, design, data)
Excellent interpersonal skills, ability to manage, mentor, and motivate a team, as well as align a diverse set of stakeholders toward a common goal
Combination of a creative mind, strategic thinking, and best practice methodologies to make the vision come to life
A "yes we can" approach
B2B/B2B2C experienceShow more Report

SciPlay is a leading developer and publisher of digital games on mobile and webplatforms, providing highly entertaining free-to-play games that millions of people play every day.
SciPlay are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Data Scientist to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for designing and implementing data science projects, analyzing and interpreting complex data sets, and creating data-driven solutions to support business decisions.
Requirements:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, Economics or a related field
Strong experience in data analysis, statistics, and machine learning – 3-5 years - MUST
Strong programming skill in R - 3-5 years - MUST. Python – advantage
Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases 3-5 years – MUST
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI/Excel
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Experience in a gaming industry is a plus
Key Responsibilities:

Understanding business problems, defining formal working frame for the problem and defining a proper solution
Develop and implement data science models end to end, algorithms, and statistical analysis
Clean, process, and analyze large and complex data sets
Create and maintain data pipelines, databases, and data visualization tools
Communicate findings and insights to stakeholders through clear and effective visualizations and presentations
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product, economy, monetization, marketing and higher management, to drive the implementation of data-driven solutions
Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in data science and machine learningShow more Report

This is us
Kaltura’s (NYSE:KLTR) mission is to power any video experience for any organization – live, on-demand, or real-time. We not only want to make using video simpler, but we also want to better people’s lives through video. Founded in 2006, Kaltura is now a global leader in the video market with millions of people using our products daily to teach, learn, watch, connect, and collaborate. Among our customers, you’ll find more than 1000 global, well-known organizations.
15+ years since starting the company, we continue to foster a diverse and collaborative work environment where everyone gets a say. Our team is currently 850+ people, and we’re still growing. We have offices in New York, London, Singapore, and Tel Aviv, but our technology is all in the cloud.
Kaltura has a fast-paced environment where initiative is always encouraged. Together with our hybrid work model and flexible state of mind, you get the right conditions for creative juices to flow freely. Thanks to our long line of products, cultivation of rich collaborative culture and care for each Kalturian, you’ll never run out of room to grow and evolve.
If you don't meet 100% of the requirements below - that's okay, nobody's perfect! We believe in hiring people, not just a list of skills. We encourage you to apply if you think this is a role that would make you excited about coming to work every day.
Requirements:

The role:
As a Product Marketing Manager, you will shape Kaltura’s Go to Market strategy using deep product insights, industry knowledge, and market intelligence. Your deep understanding of the product features and the buying process will drive change in how we market and sell our products. You will dive deep into the data from every buying process step and optimize messaging and customer touchpoints to turn leads into life-long subscribers. You will partner with product managers, marketing, and sales to define Kaltura’s market position and further scale our business.
﻿The day-to-day
Plan products GTM and execute them
Create assets for the sales & CSM teams
Communicate and train customers, salespeople, and CSMs
Conduct market and competitive analysis, user research, focus groups, and surveys
Use data to gain insights and optimize messaging, products, and marketing assets accordingly
Work closely with product, marketing, sales, customer experience, and other departments
﻿Ideally, we’re looking for:
At least one year of experience in product marketing in a Saas company
Experience in a customer-facing role, supporting enterprise sales cycles
Analytical approach and willingness to dive deep into data
Experience working cross-functionally internally to drive results
Superlative written, verbal, and visual communication skills in English
These would also be nice:
Significant advantage: worked with the EDU vertical (higher education)
Knows all about video, RTC, VOD, live, etc.
The perks:
Hybrid, flexible work environment
Extended private health (including mental) insurance
Personal and professional development programs
Occasional Cross company long weekendsShow more Report

WalkMe (NASDAQ: WKME) is growing and we want you to join us! Have you ever wanted to work in an industry leader? Well, how about an industry creator?! At WalkMe, we’re not just the leader in digital adoption, we started the digital adoption revolution - enabling organizations to measure, drive, and act to ultimately maximize the impact of their digital transformation and accelerate the return on their software investment. And with over 2,000 clients, including more than a third of Fortune 500 companies, working with us daily, we’re changing how enterprises interact with their technology.

So, if you’re looking for an opportunity to work, collaborate, and innovate with some of the most talented people out there, WalkMe is the place for you!

We’re looking for a rockstar Head of Paid Acquisition to help take digital adoption and WalkMe to the next level.


What you should bring to the table?
Experience in managing and executing demand generation programs for large-scale B2B companies (a specific experience with LinkedIn is a big advantage).
Proven track record of hitting highly-competitive growth targets by leveraging a diverse set of channels and tactics, as well as demonstrable expertise in end-to-end program development, execution and measurement.
Proven ability to employ data-driven, digital-first strategies for high-quality lead generation and opportunity acceleration through sales teams.
Experience in CRM to pull reports on specific campaigns, understand lead funnel status and manage marketing-sales feedback loops (specific experience in Salesforce - a major advantage).
Prospect-centric and data driven—you understand the lead journey, the different stages and their impact on the prospect’s entire funnel.
Great at building cross-functional relationships. You've worked closely with data, sales, design, content and operations partners to build scalable collaborations
A great communicator and team player with a contagious “can-do” attitude.
A marketing strategist who can derive insights, recommendations, and action plans from qualitative market trends, consumer feedback, internal feedback, and large data sets.
7+ years of experience in managing global paid campaigns on Google, LinkedIn, Facebook, and publications (including hands-on experience, min. $250K monthly)
At least 5 years of team management experience.
Experience in managing ABM campaigns with a sophisticated granular approach
Native level English
Strong analytical skills
What will you actually be doing?
Lead a team of campaign managers who plan and execute our paid acquisition programs
Lead the global digital marketing strategy, budget and creatives across paid acquisition channels
Work with our global program management team on activating programs on our paid acquisition channels
Work with our media partners representatives to increase scale & efficiency
Experiment and drive optimization programs to improve efficiency and performance across our paid activity
Strengthen and leverage alignment with the entire Demand Generation team: organic acquisition, field marketing, events, and outside the marketing department: Sales organization and the Customers organizations
Build customers journeys strategy that will lead our customers community to a lower churn and a higher retention rate
Why should you work for WalkMe?
We’re ranked by Dun & Bradstreet as one of the TOP 20 software companies to work for in Israel
We were recognized by Deloitte as the 6th fastest growing software company in the world
We’re publicly traded on the Nasdaq stock exchange
We provide you with the latest cutting edge tech to power your work while developing and advancing your career
We manage at eye-level, giving you the chance to work with anyone at the company. Want to pitch an idea to one of WalkMe’s founders or work on a project with our CEO? You’ve come to the right place
We recognize that you have a life outside the office. Whether it’s picking up the kids or taking some time off for yourself, we make sure you keep your work-life balance
As one of the world’s leading SaaS companies, WalkMe enables you to partner with some of the most creative, innovative, and dedicated people in the business. And when we’re not hard at work powering digital adoption, you’ll find us relaxing with a cup of coffee
And that’s just the beginning! We could go on and on, but it would probably be easier to just apply and find out moreShow more Report

Who We Are:

Seperia builds and operates global fintech review sites. From 2003, we have been driving millions of sales to our partners (advertisers). We do it by focusing on value added content, wrapped within an engaging web product and matched with high-intent traffic.

We’re looking for an ambitious and talented Product Marketing Team Lead to join the team.

What You Will Do:

Leading a small team of Project Managers, including (but not limited to): hiring, training and responsibility for personal development.
Drive the execution of our products (review sites) through their entire lifecycle: market research, competitive analysis, planning, positioning, roadmap development and ongoing product optimization.
Manage communication with international brands, evaluate their performance metrics, and drive product monetization.
Analyze users’ needs, web page performance, market trends and partnerships from an ROI perspective.
Establish project management processes, data-driven & measurability as a culture in your team.
Work closely with external development teams to track progress and ensure timely and high-quality deliverables.
Work closely with marketing teams, design and finance.

What You Need:

Great written & verbal communication skills (Hebrew & English) – must.
An independent and performance-oriented attitude with the ability to drive people and processes.
2+ years of experience in web product management, marketing project management or global website management – must.
Managerial experience – must.
Web-savvy individual.
Technical capabilities & experience working with developers.

Extra beneficial skills:

Experience in managing websites via WordPress.
Knowledge in online advertising.

What We Offer:

Huge potential for growth. Our company is growing and we’re looking for someone who can grow with us.
Freedom – we care less about formalities, and more about results. With a dynamic, informal environment, we keep excellence, innovation, and results at the forefront.
Upside – as a performance product company, we develop global-level, scalable marketing assets with no glass ceiling. You can enjoy a growing upside.Show more Report

Are you looking for meaningful work? Come to P&G where Brand Management was born!
Did you know P&G invented the concept of branding and data-driven brand management? Over the years, we have remained consistently among the top in marketing by finding new and exciting ways to reach consumers.
As a Brand Manager, you will be responsible for making sure we win with consumers' preferences in each of the following areas: When they learn about our product, When they choose to buy the product, When they use the product at home.
We are looking for the world's best marketing pros who follow one simple concept: "Consumer is boss".
Working in brand management at Procter & Gamble means being more than just a marketer, it means being a total business owner. We need someone who is dedicated and who can guide the vision and strategy behind a brand by developing marketing plans and driving innovation. Our Assistant Brand Managers need to work regularly across functions to identify consumer, shopper, and customer insights and execute marketing tactics that will continue to grow your brand profitably.
Together, we'll continue to create leading brand experiences and make a difference for nearly 5 billion consumers every single day. Pretty cool, right?
What we offer you:
Responsibilities from Day 1 – You will start of working on key brands from the beginning. Over time, as you expand your impact on the business, your responsibility and ownership of a brand will quickly grow.
Recognized state of the art marketing skills – We will constantly help you improve your marketing knowledge and management abilities.
Continuous coaching & mentorship– We are passionate about our work. We will make sure you receive both formal training and regular mentorship from your manager and others.
Dynamic and respectful work environment – We live our Purpose, Values, and Principles daily. We value every individual and encourage initiatives promoting agility and work/life balance.
As a Brand Manager, you will have opportunity to work on brands, driving the business results. You will engage with multi-disciplinary teams (including Sales, Finance, Product Supply, Advertising, and Media Agencies) to develop top strategies for your brand's success.
You will lead a mix of Marketing and Brand Management projects enabling you to show the breadth and depth of your leadership. You will need to derive insights from the data, which will enable brand leaders as they set the direction for brand growth. As your skills increase, you can expect to advance in roles with increased responsibilities. Overall, we want people who aren't afraid to take smart risks and innovate.
Qualifications

We want someone with:
Strong academic background
Excellent visionary, strategic and courageous leadership skills
Strengths with strategic and analytical thinking
An ability to drive innovation and brand growth
Strong ability to communicate and team capabilities
Up to 5 years’ experience
Fluency in English
Job locations:

Tel Aviv, Tel Aviv District, Israel Job Type: Full time Job categories: Brand Management/Marketing Req No: R000059810Show more Report

Artlist is a fast-growing creative technology company providing video creators with high-quality music, sound effects, footage and digital assets for video, as well as powerful video and image editing software. With our revolutionary license and cutting-edge creative tools, we’re on the fast track to becoming the ultimate 360 degree solution for video creators.
Today, Artlist is the go-to licensing provider for creators in over 160 countries. Among our 16M clients are Google, Apple, Nike, Coca-Cola, Ikea, Mercedes, Samsung, Wix, Netflix, Dior and many more.
Artlist consists of 3 products:
Artlist.io, a royalty-free music, stock footage platform and SFX platform
MotionArray.com, an all-in-one marketplace for creators that offers video templates, presets, music, SFX, stock footage, motion graphics and stock photos
FXhome, a cutting-edge video, VFX and image editing software
We’re seeking a full-time Junior User Acquisition Manager to join our Google Marketing Team.
Wake up for this
Manage and expand performance-based marketing campaigns.
Create smart ad targeting & compelling ad copy.
Collect and analyze campaign data to identify optimization steps for future campaigns and new opportunities
Identify and respond to changes in market trends & competition.
Work closely with other departments to optimize performance.
Requirements:

Highly skilled self-learner, eager to master new concepts independently, naturally analytical, and curious
A people-person with strong interpersonal skills that can work as part of a team
Able to manage several projects and interfaces across the marketing team and the company
Outstanding Excel & data analysis skills (pivot tables, VLOOKUP, etc.)
High level of English (written and spoken)
Familiar with Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager - Advantage
Familiar with online marketing channels, FB ads and Google Ads - AdvantageShow more Report

We are looking for a product data analyst to join an international game development company founded in 2009, dedicated to creating the best mobile and social experience for hardcore and casual gamers worldwide. With over 250 million registered users, this company is consistently ranked among top game developers.
The company employs more than 1,500 individuals worldwide and is headquartered in Herzliya Israel, with eight offices and development studios across Europe and the United States. The company's games are available on iOS, Android, and all major social networks.
The Business Performance department is responsible for enhancing the business success of the company by ensuring excellence in the performance on all business aspects including marketing, games & product design, retention, monetization, etc. The department builds, operate, and optimize the processes across the entire company through the top of the art analytical capabilities & product understanding.
Responsibilities
• Leverage data to understand the company's products in depth, identify areas of opportunity, and execute projects to drive growth and engagement of the company's users
• Work closely with the product teams to analyze existing features and ensure a successful implementation of new features.
• Use data to fine-tune and balance the game’s economy, providing economy analysis and drive metrics for revenue optimization
• Evaluating and measuring A/B testing results and trends among players
• Build and maintain reports, dashboards, and metrics to monitor the performance of products
• Be an expert on industry trends and the competitor landscape to evolve the company's thinking
What we expect
• 2+ years of experience in product analytics in the Online/Gaming industry
• BA/B.Sc. in Statistics / Math / Engineering / Economics or other quantitative fields
• Strong SQL with experience in querying large, complex data sets.
• Strong Excel skill
• Advanced knowledge in statistical tools and models- advantage
• Proven experience leading data driven projects from definition
• High level of analytical and problem-solving skills with strong attention to details
Desired
• Experience working with Qlikview – advantage
• English: Advanced
• Core competencies: Professionalism, Responsibility, Collaboration and Teamwork, Initiative and Creativity
Personal Requirements:
• Ability to collaborate with colleagues across different disciplines and locations to achieve results
• Passion for gaming
• High level of verbal and written English.Show more Report

8fig is a growth platform built to propel e-Commerce brands to new heights with cash flow planning technology and continuous, uncapped capital. Founded by supply chain experts, our growing data-driven, client-obsessed team is driven by our purpose to democratize online retail and scale eCommerce sellers to 8-figures in revenue.
We are seeking a highly experienced and talented Product Designer with at least 3 years of experience in user experience and interactive design. The ideal candidate possesses strategic thinking and a comprehensive understanding of the product development process, from research and prototyping to design and usability testing. Strong communication, organizational, and analytical skills are essential, as the candidate will be expected to continuously learn and focus on solving complex product problems.
Key Responsibilities:

Powerlink is an end-to-end business management platform tailored for your business-specific needs. From marketing to sales to customer service, and more, Powerlink makes it easy for your entire business to work together. Each department is powerful on its own, but together they can be explosive. After conquering the local market with more than 2000 satisfied Israeli customers from various industries, we are ready to go global.

Field Marketing Specialist – Israel
Fortinet (NASDAQ: FTNT) makes possible a digital world that we can always trust through its mission to protect people, devices, and data everywhere . This is why the world’s largest enterprises, service providers, and government organizations choose Fortinet to securely accelerate their digital journey. The Fortinet Security Fabric platform delivers broad, integrated, and automated protections across the entire digital attack surface, securing critical devices, data, applications, and connections from the data center to the cloud to the home office. Ranking #1 in the most security appliances shipped worldwide, more thank 595,000 customers trust Fortinet to protect their businesses. And the Fortinet NSE Training Institute, an initiative of Fortinet’s Training Advancement Agenda (TAA), provides one of the largest and broadest training programs in the industry to make cyber training and new career opportunities available to everyone. Learn more at https://www.fortinet.com , the Fortinet Blog , and FortiGuard Labs .
To accompany our exponential growth in the Israel region, Fortinet EMEA Marketing is seeking a Field Marketing Specialist in the IT Industry to help further expand our customer and market footprint in the Israeli market by focusing on brand awareness as well as lead and pipeline building activities. The right candidate for this role combines strategic thinking and tactical execution skills.
Based in Herzliya office, this position will report to the Sr. Field Marketing Manager – Eastern Europe, Israel & Greece. The Field Marketing Specialist will be working closely with sales to understand their targets, priorities and key accounts and collaborate with various EMEA marketing departments. Will be also working with the channel team to lead and coordinate all channel marketing to and through Fortinet distributor and reseller base.
Responsibilities
Develop and drive integrated marketing programs which consist of best practice marketing mix elements that generate quality prospects
Leverage and localize a repeatable and systematic set of programs to drive demand with the right balance between in country and global campaigns
Manage key marketing activities like lead gen campaigns, events (virtual and physical), industry conferences and sponsorships
Provide reporting and analysis on Field Marketing Activities
General coordination of events such as end customer days and industry conferences. This includes the preparation and follow up for each event
Work closely with sales team on VLE & Enterprise patch to build “C” level connects
Social Media usage and PR knowledge in collaboration with the PR EMEA team
Working with Fortinet Automation and Creative team to create Invitations and approve branding when needed for events
Managing and developing programs offered by Fortinet to distribution channel and customer facing partners (SIs, VARs, MSSPs, Telcos …) to increase revenues and brand preference
Analyze and measure results of channel partner related activities, in close cooperation with their respective account managers
Managing and organizing Fortinet’s presence at partner conferences and events, supporting channel partners in organizing seminars and events, and leading the production of event materials
Coordinating content creation for various purposes and tools as needed (eg. sales or marketing materials, advertorials, catalogues, channel and end user campaigns, websites)
Other duties in assisting the marketing team
Profile / Education / Experience
At least 8 years’ experience in IT Marketing/high-tech, preferably IT-Security
Complete understanding and demonstrated track record across all tactics, with integrated marketing, communications, and PR tactics to drive the pipeline: digital campaigns, call out campaigns, event management, high-touch tactics, etc.
Demonstrated success in driving marketing campaigns and promotions to meet the revenue goals of sales teams
Proven Channel Marketing experience including building marketing plans, follow-up and measurement with distributors and partners
Strong business acumen
Ability to work cross-functionally to plan and execute successful marketing programs
Ability to manage the planning and execution of programs in a deadline-driven environment
Positive attitude, strong work ethic, responsive, strong organization and communication skills
Knowledge of CRM/sales/email automation systems and how to maximize them for efficient lead distribution and reporting (SFDC or any other automation tool experience a plus)
Good English language communication skills, both written and oral
